Specific Details: General update on Revolut in Ireland, including: having more than 1.5m retail customers; the provision of free day-to-day payment services; enhancing financial literacy among children via Revolut Junior; innovations including Open Banking and SEPA Instant transfers, benefiting consumers and business; the value of market competition; consumer spending data and its value to policy-makers; Revolut's aim to achieve authorisation by the CBI and act as a post-Brexit EU hub for the business.
DPOs Lobbied: Malcolm Byrne|Senator|Seanad::Aidan O'Connor|Special Adviser|Department of Finance
Subject Matter: General update on Revolut in Ireland, including: having more than 1.5m retail customers; the provision of free day-to-day payment services; enhancing financial literacy among children via Revolut Junior; innovations including Open Banking and SEPA Instant transfers, benefiting consumers and business; the value of market competition; consumer spending data and its value to policy-makers; Revolut's aim to achieve authorisation by the CBI and act as a post-Brexit EU hub for the business.
Intended Results: Agreement that Ireland should position itself as the Number 1 EU hub for FinTech post-Brexit, and that we continue to build a pro-consumer, pro-competition business, political and regulatory environment which is supportive, efficient and adaptable to change.

Specific Details: Meeting with Senator Byrne on the Arklow Bank project
Subject Matter: Meeting with Senator Byrne on the Arklow Bank project
Intended Results:
Meeting with Senator Byrne to discuss the  Arklow Bank public consultation and to talk through challenges to Phase 1 projects ahead of ORESS and planning stage. SSE Renewables advocated that as many Phase 1 projects should get through ORESS1 so as to ensure that Ireland has the best chance of meeting its 2030 targets. 

::We also highlighted the risk to projects from running the auction without planning permission as it will likely lead to attrition. We highlighted challenges that the Phase 2 policy statement has created for our pipeline and outlined that broader DMAPs should be defined without delay as well as the need for more ambition on deployment of technology, including fixed bottom solutions.
